intro: Chamerion angustifolium f. pleniflorum, commonly known as the showy yellow gentian, is a flowering plant characterized by its striking, bright yellow flowers. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is native to arctic and alpine regions of Europe and Asia. The plant typically grows in moist, rocky habitats and produces numerous small, clustered flowers that bloom in late summer. Its foliage consists of narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. This variant is notable for its increased floral display compared to the typical form of the species.
